org.gearvrf

Class GVRShaderData

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.gearvrf.GVRHybridObject
      • org.gearvrf.GVRShaderData
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    GVRMaterial

    public class GVRShaderData
extends GVRHybridObject
    GVRShaderData encapculates data to be sent to a vertex or fragment shader. It contains a list of key / value pairs which can specify arbitrary length float or int vectors. It also has key / value pairs for the texture samplers to be used with the shader.

    GVRShaderData can be used for a "post-effect" to update the framebuffer after main rendering but before lens distortion. A post effect shader can, for example, apply the same shader to each eye, using different parameters for each eye.

    See Also:
    GVRMaterial, GVRCamera.addPostEffect(GVRMaterial), GVRRenderData.setMaterial(GVRMaterial)

    • Constructor Detail

      • GVRShaderData

        public GVRShaderData(GVRContext gvrContext,
                     GVRShaderId shaderId)
        Initialize shader data for a specific shader.

        The names and types of the data required by the shader are encapsulated in the uniform descriptor and the texture descriptor. These are inherited from the shader and describe the uniforms and texture samplers used by the shader.

        Parameters:
        gvrContext - Current GVRContext
        shaderId - Shader ID from GVRMaterial.GVRShaderType or GVRContext.getMaterialShaderManager().
        See Also:
        GVRShader, GVRShaderTemplate

      • GVRShaderData

        protected GVRShaderData(GVRContext gvrContext,
                        GVRShaderId shaderId,
                        long constructor)

    • Method Detail

      • getShaderType

        public GVRShaderId getShaderType()
        Get the shader type for this material.
        Returns:
        GVRShaderId designating the shader this material uses.

      • getUniformDescriptor

        public java.lang.String getUniformDescriptor()
        Gets the string describing the uniforms allowed in this material.

        This descriptor contains a name and a type for each uniform required by the shader. The types may be int, float or mat. A type can be followed by an integer between 2 and 4 giving the vector length. Any entry may be an array of values.

        Uniform descriptor examples:

      • float4 u_color float u_opacity
      • mat4 u_bones[60]
      • float4 diffuse, float4 specular, int blend_ops[3]
Returns:
string with uniform descriptor from shader

  • getTextureDescriptor

    public java.lang.String getTextureDescriptor()
    Gets the string describing the textures allowed in this material.

    This descriptor contains a name and a sampler type for each texture used by the material (e.g. "sampler2D diffuseTex, samplerCube cubeMap")

    Returns:
    string with texture descriptor from shader

    public boolean hasUniform(java.lang.String name)
    Determine whether a named uniform has been set in this material.
    Parameters:
    name - of uniform in shader and material
    Returns:
    true if uniform has been assigned a value, else false

  • hasTexture

    public boolean hasTexture(java.lang.String name)
    Determine whether a named texture has been set. This function will return true if the texture has been set even if it is null.
    Parameters:
    name - of texture
    Returns:
    true if texture has been set, else false
    See Also:
    getTexture(java.lang.String), hasUniform(java.lang.String)

  • setFloatArray

    public void setFloatArray(java.lang.String key,
                          float[] val)
    Set the value for a floating point vector uniform.

    Parameters:
    key - name of uniform to set.
    val - floating point array with new data. The size of the array must be at least as large as the uniform being updated.
    Throws:
    java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if key is not in uniform descriptor or array is wrong length.
    See Also:
    getFloatVec(String)
